item.title: Interesting data structures: the BK-tree
item.description: A BK-tree is a tree data structure specialized to index data in a metric space. A metric space is essentially a set of objects which we equip with a distance function \(d(a, b)\) for every pair of elements \((a, b)\). This distance function must satisfy a set of axioms in order to ensure it's well-behaved. The exact reason why this is required will be explained in the "Search" paragraph below.
